messages: e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:26): ok, Mercurial experts. Does anyone know how to link to a range of commits in web frontend?
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:26): I would like to link to the commits from last week on http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/webcomponents
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (18:46): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024: I wonder if you can get the history for a dir, and get the links from there
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:46): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb: I hacked it this way for now:
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:46): 1) get to the end of the revision you need. For example: http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/webcomponents/shortlog/79
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:47): 2) add revcount param to limit it to the number of commits in range: http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/webcomponents/shortlog/79?revcount=28
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:48): it's buggy, because the revcount param stick around while navigating, but it works
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (18:49): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024: thanks for the explanation
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:00): :) I learned it by reading http://selenic.com/hg/file/7b7f03502b5a/mercurial/hgweb/webcommands.py
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:01): is it worth throwing on a wiki?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:02): somewhat surprised http://www.w3.org/wiki/Mercurial does not exist
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:02): I think you should put it there unless MikeSmith / shepazu have a better idea
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:10): procedural question: if I want to ask for comments on a spec, does this mean it's an editor's draft, and the email I'll be sending is a Cfc?
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:11): or is there more magic involved?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:11): Asking for comments is asking for comments
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:12): CfC is Call for Consensus
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:12): you should do [components] Update from the Editor
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (19:12): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024: don't worry about any of the silly process stuff‚Ä¶ just ask for feedback
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:12): and tell what you have been doing and what you want feedback on
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:15): should I put editor's draft on the spec though?
